page.title: 01Sutton Park Ninevah
page.content: Sutton Park and Ninevah is predominantly undulating countryside mostly intensively farmed. The higher land and fringes of valleys are wooded with a mixture of deciduous and coniferous trees. Hopyards have completely disappeared giving way to wheat, oilseed rape, barley and oats and some fodder roots. One small area has apple orchards. Sheep and beefcattle graze on intensively grown grass.Silage is made rather than hay for winter feeding in covered yards. Most sheep are housed for lambing in the early months of the year. A riding schol with an all weather facility is the only recreational establishment besides the Public House. The nursing home was converted from a farm house and is privately owned.
